Generic interface specifying how a ViCom interface loader looks like.
Helper class to load dynamic libraries. Used in CViComLoader.
Definition of receiver error events. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Definition of receiver warning events. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Definition of raw packet types. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
ViCom data processors are listeners which can be registered at an ViCom interface to retrieve different kind of data.
Imaginary part of the value.
Real part of the value.
Complex long value. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Imaginary part of the value.
Real part of the value.
Complex float value. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Measurement rate in 0.001 per second.
Time of the last measurement (or time next to the last measurement) taken for meas rate calculation in seconds.
Time of the first measurement the meas rate has been calculated in seconds.
Count of measurements in the time interval defined below.
All measurements taken in the last minute. Within the first minute after the first measurement the interval is shorter.
All measurements from the first measurement 2 minutes after the first measurement to the last measurement.
From first to last available measurement.
Invalid rate type.
Rate type \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Measurement rates result structure for specific ViComs. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
The available RF front ends of a connected receiver are listed in SReceiver::dwAvailableFrontEndMask which is an or-combination of the following constants. \@attribute[type="serializable"]

Signalizes why attenuation is used or suppressed.
Normally attenuation is introduced if we get IF overflows at the RF AD converters. Then IF_OVERFLOW is reported. But there exists a special scanning mode to estimate intermodulation products. This mode is only active for GSM scanning. When RF measurement may be affected by intermodulation it bridges the preamplifier (PA_OFF) and reports INTERMODULATION. * \@attribute[type="serializable"]

Type and power of attenuation.
The meaning of the enumeration values can be derived using the look-up table shown below:
PA_ON, PA_OFF: preamplifier on/off RFx: nominal x dB RF attenuation (the true value is calibrated and may vary from the nominal value) IFx: nominal IF attenuation (does not influence the noise figure) \@attribute[type="serializable"]

This can be used to report the current fill state of the result buffer and a history how many results had to be removed from the buffer before they could be processed. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Specifies the severity levels of a message \@attribute[type="serializable"]

Structure that describes a message from a sub-system. A message can be either just an info or even an error message. Used in ViComBasicInterface::GetMessagesDuringStartMeasurement(). \@attribute[type="serializable"]

The TSM receiver types have an internal time base. This time base has to be synchronized to another reference. Note that not all modes are supported in some measurement. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
number of results that will be stored at most in the buffer. Must be within [ dwMin; dwMax ].*

This structure defines the size of the internal result buffer that will be used to cache results from the specific interfaces. The default and the maximum is 1024 the minimum is 1. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
\@attribute[type="array" size="dwCountOfReceivers" sizeismember="true"]
Receiver calibration information.
Container for calibration information of the receiver. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
List of receiver options.
Container for option information of the receiver. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
List of receiver temperatures.
Specifies the type of a receiver temperature. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Container for receiver temperatures. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
List of frequency bands supported by the receiver. Each sub band is specified in Hz.
measurement capabilities of the device.

This defines what special capabilities the receiver has. This value is a or-combination of the constants defined below. For each capability, there is another application interface that can be used to access the specific functionality. For example, if dwFlagForRFPowerScan flag is set, then the ViComRFPowerScanInterface can be used for that receiver.
Version of the installed hardware inclusive FPGA configuration code, to be read as an 8 digit decimal integer Example: TSMW FW Version 1.15.0.0 => dwHardwareVersion = 0x010F0000
Version of the application software, to be read as an 8 digit decimal integer.
Model number of the receiver.
Serial number of the receiver.
Defines the receiver type. The command set of this interface is compatible with certain receiver types.
Index of the used network interface if not SDefs::INVALID_DWORD_VALUE
Version of the internet protocol for TSMW and TSME.
TSMW and TSME receiver are connected via IEEE 802.3 Ethernet bus. The address is formated in a dot-decimal like notation, e.g. the first array element is the first octet of the address.
Version of the used IEEE1394 firewire driver.
TSMx receiver are connected in a chain from the PC. 1 means next to the PC.
For each receiver connected to the system, one such structure is filled. dwCountOfReceivers contains how many instances of this structure are available. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
There can not be more than 8 receivers connected to one PC at a time.

When the system is asked for how many devices are connected, this structure is the result. This contains - version information - hardware information - driver information about every receiver that was connected before and are still active.
@note The table does not contain receivers of various types. E.g. if the system is asked for connected devices on a TSMW, the connected receiver table will not contain any receivers other than TSMW! \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Specifies operation modes for the TSME6 pre-selection stage. \@attribute[type="serializable"]

The AGC time constant defines how long a measured input power in RF spectrum scan is valid to control internal attenuation / gain settings in the receiver. The validity is floating and decrements exponentially (linear in dB). After the given time the power in Watt degrades by 1/e i.e. 4.34 dB in logarithmic scale. The measured RF spectrum is used to find RF board settings to protect the receiver against intermodulation on high input power. This results in lower sensitivity (higher noise figure) during high input power reception. The 30 sec default value is good for normal drive test. With this value the receiver is sensitive in rural areas and well protected against intermodulation in urban areas with very high transmitter density. Applies to TSME / TSME6 receivers only. Can only be set for the very first link to a TSME / TSME6. Limits: 1ms to 60 sec, default: 30 sec *
Definition of special receiver settings. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Definition of operating modes for special receiver ports. Only a subset of the following settings might be supported by specific receiver ports in STSMPort::ePort. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Special ports of the receiver. \@attribute[type="serializable"]

The multi purpose receiver I/O connectors can be used for application specific requirements like external trigger signals or timing reference. The configuration has to be done by specifying a port and the wanted mode. Used in ViComBasicInterface::SetPortConfiguration() method. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Definitions for technology types. \@attribute[type="serializable"]

The following functions can be used to get error information from an object of class CViComError. A full list of general ViCom errors can be found in the header file ViComBasicErrors.h, and a list of specific errors are in ViCom***Errors.h.
